result.execSummary:
The defendant Andre A Hightower was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>15-40g), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)3.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: To any other sentence, with credit for 3 days (04-02-2015 to 04-04-2015) time served.
*Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison.
*Same conditions as probation except for condition time.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 
*Fine is set at ZERO.
*Provide DNA sample, if not already done.

*Regularly participate in an HSED or GED program. 
*Maintain full time employment/school or a combination of both.

*No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor. 
*Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
*Defendant may not be in any automobile where a firearm is present. 
*Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

*No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
*Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00 at one time.
*No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
*Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time. 
*Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate. 
*No contact with Dandre H. (DOB 08-02-1995).

*Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.
*Defendant to notify Department of Corrections agent of all prescriptions within 3 business days/72 hours of receiving prescription from medical professional.
*Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by Department of Corrections Agent, and notify the Department of Corrections agent of the pharmacy used.
*Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
*Complete Parenting or Fatherhood course. 
*Defendant to participate in a Cognitive Behavior program or cognitive intervention program.
*Drivers license suspension is not imposed.

*Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
*Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.

timeConds.notes: *Forthwith, without goodtime credit; release for The Day Reporting Center, work, inmate work assignments at the House of correction. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.

Huber/Work Release Modification Request

Request for Huber / Work Release Modification received from HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge Stark Br 17 for review. os

Signed and filed:  Decision and Order Denying Request to Modify Sentence.

*copy to defendant and district attorney*
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Carolina Stark, Branch 17, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request to modify sentence.

Defendant Andre A Hightower in court with attorney Cheryl Anne Ward.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. 

AS TO COUNT 2:

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 3 days (04-02-2015 to 04-04-2015)time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed defendant on probation for 3 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
 - Court ordered defendant to serve 10 MONTHS CONDITION TIME in the House of Correction forthwith, without goodtime credit; release for The Day Reporting Center, work, inmate work assignments at the House of correction. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AND CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.
- Defendant to notify Department of Corrections agent of all prescriptions within 3 business days/72 hours of receiving prescription from medical professional.
- Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by Department of Corrections Agent, and notify the Department of Corrections agent of the pharmacy used. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00 at one time.
- No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
- Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor. 
- Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
- Defendant may not be in any automobile where a firearm is present. 
- Regularly participate in an HSED or GED program. 
- Maintain full time employment/school or a combination of both. 
- Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate. 
- No contact with Dandre H. (DOB 08-02-1995).
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
- Complete Parenting or Fatherhood course. 
- Defendant to participate in a Cognitive Behavior program or cognitive intervention program.
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Drivers license suspension is not imposed.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 941.29(1m) or (4m).

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting; Notice & Acknowledgement; 
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Letter filed on behalf of defendant received and filed. tk
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Defendant Andre A Hightower in court with attorney Cheryl Anne Ward.  Paul Michael Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion regarding a resolution that took place on 2/9/2016 placed on the record. Both parties requested a negotiated resolution. 

As to Amended Count 2:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. Case set for sentencing on 3/7/2016. 


As to Count 1:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered Count 1 dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Held off the record. Defendant provided proof that defendant is eligible for public defender respresentation. Case is adjourned for status of counsel to 10-14-2015 at 8:30 am, branch 17.

Defendant Andre A Hightower in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case set for final pretrial. State requested an adjournment of the trial. Defense objects to an adjournment moves to dismiss case. Court denied defense request. Attorney Toran informs Court he will no longer be able to represent the defendant for reasons placed on the record.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed. Court grants defense motion to withdraw as counsel. Court vacated jury trial on 10-14-2015 at 9:00 am.  Case passed and ordered the defendant to report to the public defenders office and be evaluated for represented, and to return to court either way.
